267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:41): How could i open a Firefox web browser instance when i click on a button in c#
267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:41): i want to open an url .. but in a FireFox browser
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (18:42): you could exexute firefox.exe and pass the url as the first parameter
267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:43): ya but i want to make a c# program
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (18:44): i've not done it myself
0181de1ddc86a293e88d79be03528b86 (18:47): how do you find out the value of '~', IE the current virtual directory (the url, not the physical path on the server)
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:48): some`one: check System.Diagnostics.Process.Start, if Firefox is your default browser you should be able to give Process.Start a url and it will open Firefox
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:49): if Firefox isn't your default browser then you'll need to get the location of the Firefox exe
267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:49): but now.. need to open an url
267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:50): gringod_work and if is not my default browser.. ?
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:50): you should be able to do: System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(@"C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox 2 Beta 2\firefox.exe http://www.example.com");
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:50): or may: System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(@"C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox 2 Beta 2\firefox.exe","http://www.example.com");
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:50): can never remember which off-hand
267fec5f03b35b64d9f29ec8ae5ba15d (18:51): but, work if isn`t my default browser?
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:52): that will work what ever your default browser is... assuming firefox is always in that folder
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (18:56): remember it's very bad to hardcode paths though
d086a635c2f2d3689d351443f620dc3b (18:56): try looking in the registry for install dir
af84580d5d36e5a694109317c1f53a2d (18:56): indeed, you may be best putting it in a config file

a6dfa26a18ef640700a1ccc01a3efe23 (19:10): An error has occurred while establishing a connection to the server.  When connecting to SQL Server 2005, this failure may be caused by the fact that under the default settings SQL Server does not allow remote connections. 132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:11): yeah go in the SQL Configuration tool on the server and allow remote connection
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:11): they're not allowed by default (in express) iirc
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:13): check if the SQL Browser service is started
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:13): i had this problem once and that made it
